answers.answer: Feeling faint is caused by shortness of breath and like you said, shortness of breath is caused by baby pushing up your diaphragm.  I don't know about the diarrhea though...did you just have it this morning (maybe something you ate?) or you've had it for a while?  If it persists, call your dr.

I just had the diarrhea in the morning. I overloaded on veggies and oatmeal yesterday and that's probably why.But now I'm being paranoid because even though I was checked for gestational diabetes about a month ago and everything was fine, my professor this morning (I was sick in an anatomy & physiology class) said it could crop up at any time.
I threw up until the moment I pushed my son out of there...I also had on and off bouts of the runs...With my daughter I threw up once...Do you feel flu-ish?Hang in there, it's almost over!!!
Hey there,I am 35 weeks as you and I am still puking my brains out! I am thankfull for every day my morning sickness forgets to stop by! It will be over soon...hang in there!

I am alsmost 33w and only with in the last week have I found any wort of relief from vomiting every day!! Doc gave me Phenergren gel to rub on my wrists every 6 hours for the first few days then down to whenever I feel I need it. It is truely the most miraculous thing!! Only downside is it makes you sleepy....but hey, who argues with a nap here or there :o)

question: Hi~I'm starting my 35th week and this morning had hot and cold shivers and eventually had diarrhea. I felt slight faint briefly and was short of breath, but after going to the bathroom and lying down I felt fine. I know the shortness of breath is the crowding of the lungs, as this has been happening for awhile. But, in your opinion ladies, should I be more concerned?I know this sounds stupid, but I had an appointment in the afternoon, and since I felt better and the heartbeat was strong, I didn't even bring it up. Now I feel really dumb...Thanks
title: Nausea in third trimester?
